snippet: The Chinese department store in Manhattan, which opened in 1971, has been a welcome alternative to restaurant and supermarket jobs for immigrant workers. It will close in December because of a significant rent increase.
abstract: Manhattan's Pearl River Mart, department store that is slated for closure amid rising rent, served as cultural refuge and employment lifeline for Chinese immigrants since it opened in 1971.
lead_paragraph: The Chinese department store in Manhattan, which opened in 1971, has been a welcome alternative to restaurant and supermarket jobs for immigrant workers. It will close in December because of a significant rent increase.

headline.main: At Pearl River, Four Decades of Helping New Arrivals From Asia
headline.print_headline: For 4 Decades, Serving as Lifeline for Immigrants

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Pearl River Mart (Manhattan, NY, Retail Store)
